page.title: 17SAILING IN HUNTINGDON.
page.content: Sailing is a popular water sport on reservoirs, lakes and flooded gravel pits.The boats are made from wood or glassfibre,and their sails from terylene.Masts are made from wood or aluminium. The boats are looked after by their owners and are left at the club during the summer.Repairs are done at home in the winter.There are many different kinds of sailing dinghy and each kind is given a handicap figure.The rules are controlled by the international yacht racing union.To join a club people ask and if accepted pay a fee of around Â£35 per year.They race to handicap rules and sail for fun to find who is the best sailor each week.It helps to keep them fit, and helps get away from work.
